body:
Hello @sundar19, thank you for your interest in our work! Ultralytics has open-sourced YOLOv5 at https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5, featuring faster, lighter and more accurate object detection. YOLOv5 is recommended for all new projects.

To continue with this repo, please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom model or data training question, please note that Ultralytics does **not** provide free personal support. As a leader in vision ML and AI, we do offer professional consulting, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production solutions for our clients, such as: - **Cloud-based AI** systems operating on **hundreds of HD video streams in realtime.** - **Edge AI** integrated into custom iOS and Android apps for realtime **30 FPS video inference.** - **Custom data training**, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination. For more information please visit https://www.ultralytics.com.

I think it should work:
python3 detect.py --source 1

> I think it should work:
> python3 detect.py --source 1

Tried exactly same @Tomlac92  but its not working

maybe in addition to this, try change 11 line in detect.py
 webcam = source == '0' or source.startswith('rtsp') or source.startswith('http') or source.endswith('.txt')
to:
 webcam = source == '1' or source.startswith('rtsp') or source.startswith('http') or source.endswith('.txt')

if it still will be not working, I have not another idea, so authors of the repo will need to help.

@Tomlac92 @sundar19 I've updated YOLOv5 with a fix to allow you to pass any number for local webcam selection in https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/commit/82ed33a052081f122df7cc8b94e7009d7ec35c2d.

I won't be pushing the same fix here but you can try to implement the same changes in yolov3, or git clone yolov5 and try there (recommended).
@Tomlac92 Thanks I have tried both of the ways , @glenn-jocher  Thank you so much!
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
I ran python3 detect. Py --source 1 successfully but how do I save the recognition results?
@Gaoang112 you mean you want to write it as a video file?
Yes, I want to check the results, videos or.txt files

@Gaoang112 @sundar19 you can use the following commands to save image and text inference results. I would highly recommend running this using our YOLOv5 repository however, where this functionality is much improved.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5

`python detect.py --source 1 --save-txt`

For saving images set `save_img=True` in detect.py
